channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Enrich Your Future
item.description: This engaging book is simultaneously memorable and humorous. The numerous sports analogies will have you smiling as you absorb Larry Swedroe's unforgettable investment precepts.

item.title: UAW’s next big Southern test after winning Tennessee union vote is Alabama
item.description: The UAW has accused the German carmaker of violating U.S. and German labor laws with aggressive anti-union tactics, which the company denies.

item.title: CAPE Is High: Should You Care?
item.description: A simple analysis shows that Robert Shiller's cyclically adjusted price-to-earnings ratio changed in the 1990s and that mean-reversion concerns may be misplaced. If CAPE changed three decades ago, however, there is nothing preventing it from doing so again.

item.title: Gen Zers are puzzling the American workplace. To understand them, look at the pre-war generation, not millennials
item.description: Gen Z has grown up with financial uncertainty, war, and political tumult. Their inherent skepticism can become a superpower in the right context.

item.title: AI to the Rescue? Overhauling the US Power Grid on the Path to Net Zero
item.description: Once known as secure and profitable investments, utilities are now viewed as enterprises fraught with financial risks. Investors should favor utilities that employ AI and other digital strategies to minimize damage from natural disasters.

item.title: Over 70% of the world's workforce is likely to be exposed to excessive heat during their careers
item.description: The International Labor Organization suggested ways that governments can help cope with the rising effects of climate change on workers.

item.title: Does a Stock’s Price Influence Its Risk Profile?
item.description: As a stock falls in value, it becomes more sensitive to market movements and its total volatility increases.

item.title: Hawaii lawmakers target Maui vacation rentals after Lahaina wildfire supercharges housing shortage and exorbitant prices
item.description: The Aug. 8 wildfire killed 101 people and destroyed housing for 6,200 families, amplifying Maui's already acute housing shortage.

item.title: Managing Regret Risk: The Role of Asset Allocation
item.description: Regret risk is a quantifiable phenomenon. The answer for some clients may be equally weighted portfolios.

item.title: Biden marks Earth Day with $7bn in residential solar grants for projects serving 900,000 low- and middle-income households
item.description: The projects are expected to eventually reduce emissions by the equivalent of 30 million metric tons of carbon dioxide and save households $350 million annually.
